subclusters.subcluster_name: General Adaptive Hormesis Theory via Cellular Signaling
Exercise and Oxidative Stress-Induced Hormesis Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Radiation-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on hormesis induced by low-dose ionizing radiation, invalidating LNT model and involving oxidative stress and metabolic adaptations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Radiation-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes low-dose radiation stimulating DNA repair, immune responses, and lifespan extension with J-shaped dose response.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Radiation-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains hormetic effects of natural background radiation on longevity and cancer mortality via protective biological mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Radiation-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows hormesis by X-irradiation in C. elegans dauer larvae extending lifespan through protective enzyme upregulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Radiation-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mechanism of hormesis via transcription-blocking DNA damage leading to somatotropic attenuation and enhanced stress resistance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Adaptive Hormesis Theory via Cellular Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes hormesis as a universal adaptive response involving conserved signaling pathways (NF-κB, MAPK, AMPK, mTOR) and oxidative stress mitigation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Adaptive Hormesis Theory via Cellular Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on hormesis as a general adaptive aging mechanism mediated by transcription factors (NF-κB, CREB, Nrf2) linking homeostasis and neuroplasticity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Adaptive Hormesis Theory via Cellular Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes hormesis as a biphasic dose response with universal lifespan extension across models and interventions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Adaptive Hormesis Theory via Cellular Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates hormesis as an evolutionarily conserved adaptive strategy enhancing repair and healthspan with quantitative plasticity limits.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Adaptive Hormesis Theory via Cellular Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Clinical anti-aging strategies based on hormesis activating maintenance and repair pathways at multiple biological levels.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Adaptive Hormesis Theory via Cellular Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes hormesis and preconditioning enhancing biological resilience and protecting against age-related decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Adaptive Hormesis Theory via Cellular Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows hormesis via phytochemicals activating cellular defense pathways and longevity-related signaling cascades.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Adaptive Hormesis Theory via Cellular Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Toxin-induced hormesis activates conserved signaling pathways (PI3K/Akt/mTOR, AMPK) modulating aging rate.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Exercise and Oxidative Stress-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on hormesis induced by moderate exercise-generated ROS that upregulate antioxidant defenses and improve health.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Exercise and Oxidative Stress-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes exercise-induced mild oxidative stress triggering adaptive antioxidant and repair systems affecting multiple tissues.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Exercise and Oxidative Stress-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Caloric restriction increases ROS as hormetic signals activating protective pathways that extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Exercise and Oxidative Stress-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: IL-6 hormesis with low-dose anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects, linking cytokine signaling to aging resilience.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Exercise and Oxidative Stress-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Flavonoid-induced hormesis with senolytic activity and enhancement of aging-related biological performance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Exercise and Oxidative Stress-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Vitamin-mediated hormesis inducing mild stress responses that modulate aging hallmarks and promote longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Polyphenol and Xenohormesis-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Olive polyphenols induce hormesis via AMPK and Nrf2 activation and modulation of vitagenes for neuroprotection.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Polyphenol and Xenohormesis-Induced Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Polyphenol metabolites induce hormesis through sirtuin pathway activation and metabolic reprogramming in C. elegans.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Heat Shock Protein-Mediated Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Heat-induced hormesis extends lifespan via upregulation of heat shock proteins (Hsp70) enhancing stress resistance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Heat Shock Protein-Mediated Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mild heat-shock induces longevity by reducing mortality rates and enhancing stress resistance in C. elegans.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Heat Shock Protein-Mediated Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Early mild heat stress primes increased Hsp70 synthesis later in life, improving cellular maintenance and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Heat Shock Protein-Mediated Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Heat treatment extends lifespan in Drosophila by physiological induction of stress resistance independent of reproduction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Heat Shock Protein-Mediated Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Heat-induced longevity in yeast requires metabolic reprogramming, mitochondrial ROS signaling, and glutathione recycling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Heat Shock Protein-Mediated Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Hypergravity acts as a hormetic stressor inducing protective mechanisms including heat shock proteins affecting longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Adaptive Hormesis Theory via Cellular Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: NF-κB signaling as a central hub mediating hormesis-induced protective responses during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Adaptive Hormesis Theory via Cellular Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Hormesis-based adaptive plasticity in brain aging linking energy metabolism, synaptic plasticity, and lifestyle factors.
